comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Dancer. NYT of Nov 12, 1911 describes her as a seventeen year-old just arrived from La Scala. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50F12FC355517738... See also

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: She was born in 1896 in Milano and died on April 30, 1940 in Milano. She was the "première danseuse" of the NY Metropolitan Opera from 1914 to 1930 and ballet mistress from 1919 to 1935 (according to fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosina_Galli_%28danseuse%29) See also books.google.ch/books?id=Tm-AAAAAQBAJ&pg=PT294&dq... news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1787&dat=19300619&... "My Life as a Ballet-Dancer" by Rosina Galli (www.unz.org/Pub/Forum-1919jul-00011) In broadway.cas.sc.edu/content/maria-gambarelli she is described as "cruel".

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: In March 1916, a series of concerts, whose purpose was to raise funds for the establishing of an Italian theatre in NY, was given in the Waldorf. Rosina Galli and Giuseppe Bonfiglio gave a group of dances (NYT, March 19, 1916, query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=FB0811F63E591A...)
